ygData.subject: Re: IMPORTANT! lifetaps bugged
ygData.msgSnippet: i don t think so...the spell is just bugged in some strange way. ex: 1.)cast lifedraw with full mana...takes about 1.3 bubs of mana. 2.)cast lifedraw with 0.6
ygData.messageBody:
i don't think so...the spell is just bugged in some strange way.

ex:

1.)cast lifedraw with full mana...takes about 1.3 bubs of mana.
2.)cast lifedraw with 0.6 of a bubble of mana and it simply eats all the
available mana.

the healing and damage effects remain exactly the same in each case. so the
spell does not "require" 135ish mana, it only requires 63 like it's supposed
to but for some reason it will eat 135ish mana if that mana is available.

kg


>From: Chip Paul <cpaul@...>
>Reply-To: shadowknight@onelist.com
>To: shadowknight@onelist.com
>Subject: Re: [shadowknight] IMPORTANT! lifetaps bugged
>Date: Thu, 28 Oct 1999 16:12:14 -0500
>
>Krukhan Garabash wrote:
> >
> > From: "Krukhan Garabash" <krukhan@...>
> >
> > all 3 new taps are bugged. the amount of mana required to cast them is
> > roughly 2x of that specified.
> >
> > lifedraw: specified on the scroll as 63 - requires: 135ish
> > lifespike: specified on the scroll as 18 - requires: 30ish
> > lifetap: never cast - safe to assume it is bugged in the same manner.
> >
> > please use:
> >
> > /petition
> > /bug
> > /feedback
> >
> > to report this problem. a large number of reports will ensure that it is
> > fixed quickly.
> >
>
>Do you think that it deducts the mana once for the damage, and
>another for the healing? I'll check this out for myself and report the
>bug if it's the same for me.
>
>Xilith
